data.title: Diamond in the Rough
data.text: This place could be on Diners, Drive-ins & Dives. A dive, maybe, but the food is excellent.  And the atmosphere just adds to it. I'm definitely coming back to this place the next time I visit Charleston. I'll be ordering the fish and chips because that's pretty much all there is. Add-ons are the mashed peas and the gravy. I skipped the gravy - maybe next time. The fish was made to order, of course. Probably the best fish and chips I've ever eaten.

data.title: Huge portions
data.text: Don't let the location keep you away. The biggest piece of fish you'll find anywhere. Nothing else on the menu.. Just fish and chips. The owner is from the UK. Super nice guy. The homemade tarter sauce is on point. Make sure you ask for it.

data.title: A home from home...
data.text: As an Englishman on holiday I was hankering for some good ol' fish and chips, someone mentioned North Charleston of all places, hard by the old Navy yard.  I knew it was going to be good when I spotted HP Sauce on the outside tables, and I was not disappointed.  A total gem, and proprietor Adam the most welcoming owner I've met in ages. If you are within reach, GO, today!

data.title: Worth the wait.  The food is cooked to order.
data.text: We had heard good things about this place and this past Saturday we gave it a try.  We all had the Fish and Chips; my wife and I had Mushy Peas, also.  Everything was great.  The word on the street was that they were serving curry on the side- something I personally "really" like.  I was a little bummed to find that the shipment of curry was not yet in.. so I'll need to make another trip for that.  We are looking forward to our next visit there.

data.title: English Fayre
data.text:
This little gem is in an out of the way place, in an area that's being redeveloped but don't be put off. Food is basic fish & chips.............but it's good, just like what's served in Good Ole Blighty. if you are a Brit you will 'get it'...........if you're American you may think the 'fries' are soggy & need Tartar sauce. if you're a Brit you know that the chips are delicious & need nothing but a sprinkling of salt & a drizzle of malt vinegar.
   They are slowly adding to their menu, which is important. No point rushing things to the detriment of what you are already serving. Staff are pleasant & very attentive. lf you are an ex-pat missing some home comforts or just wanting to try something other than the Southern cuisine. Go & try the Codfather, you won't be disappointed, l'm sure.

data.title: Codaweful
data.text: We went here with good expectations after reading some of the reviews. Sadly we were disappointed. Fish was overbattered and greasy. Large flakes of crust fell off while eating. Batter to fish ratio was way off. Since the fish was on top of the chips it transferred the grease to the chips. Chips lacked flavor or texture. They do give you a large piece of fish and they have good customer service. We went on a Saturday and the owner wasn't cooking so maybe that make a difference. Won't be returning.

data.title: Andy Capp would be proud!
data.text: Tried a spot I had heard a lot about, so myself and friends tried out The Codfather..not really in the best part of town (Reynolds Ave next to old Navy Shipyard)...but the food is touted as "genuine" English Fish 'n Chips, better be since the owner is British...they DID NOT disappoint...served up fresh and hot, VERY generous portions for the money...gotta' get there for lunch or early afternoon as they usually sell out of their daily fresh portions...Check 'em out...you won't be disappointed mate!

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Great place. Best Fish and Chips we ever had in the U.S. Just like it's done in England. Friendly staff. Owner is from England so he knows his stuff. Highly recommend. We'll definitely be back. Getting so popular they'll need to expand.

data.title: Loved it!
data.text:
This little hole in the wall is owned by a Brit and serves authentic fish and chips. So good!   It's in an out-of-the-way location in North Charleston. 
A few tables inside -- we sat at one of the two picnic tables outdoors and it was fun talking to others -- all first timers at Codfathers (You gotta love the name!)
Worth the trip from Charleston or Mt. Pleasant.

data.title: Best this side of the pond
data.text:
Having lived in London and Australia I am no stranger to fish and chips.  You'd be hard pressed to find better than what they offer here.  These are made to order and there is usually a line out the door.  While the location isn't exactly in an area with heavy foot traffic that's part of the charm and well worth the visit.  

The authenticity and simplicity is something that Charleston is sorely lacking.  Great work!

data.title: Definitely don't miss this place on your visit!
data.text: Off the beaten path - small place that's BIG on flavor and VALUE!  Great prices and the food is fantastic.

data.title: Great Fish and Chips
data.text: Don't let the neighborhood or the looks of the place put you off.  Very friendly service and delicious golden fish and chips.  The orders are huge so unless you want to take some home or you are really hungry, order the half order or split an order. Full order is only $10. It is counter service but delivered to you in a small dining room or at outside tables. The counter employee came out and checked on all the diners several times and brought extra tarter sauce with a smile.  We will return.

data.title: Real Fish and Chips
data.text: Visited The Cod Father on the recommendation of a co-worker, it is really off the beaten path. When you pull up in front of the restaurant you may not be impressed and you will normally have to wait since all the fish and chip's are made to order but once you get your order you will forget all about the wait.  I have had fish and chips in Scotland and England and this is the closest to proper fish and chips I have had since.  The portions are large, hot and very tasty.

data.title: Authentic
data.text: Went for lunch. Make sure to use GPS, as it's a bit hard to find. Located in a small hole in the wall on the old naval base. All they serve is fish and chips with sides of gravy and mushy peas, but that's great. Huge piece of fish done perfectly. Much better then what we had in Gibraltar. Not much seating, almost hope that too many people don't find out how great it is. Only kidding! Will definitely go back.

data.title: Seriously, proper!
data.text:
AMAZING! We lived in England for nearly 10 years, so we know fish and chips. The Codfather is authentic, proper fish and chips! Perfect batter, thick chips, superb flavor. Not a lot of seating, but that makes it just like an English chippy. Owner came and talked with us, a really kind man who knows his stuff. He's done it all just right and cares to make your experience and food the best. We chose the classic fish and chips, although you can add mushy peas and/or gravy. The fish was perfectly crispy and the batter was just like you get in England. The chips are the perfect crispy on the outside, tender on the inside. Flavor was spot on.
There is a reason people are raving about this new restaurant, a reason why the line is so long, a reason why they often sell out...it's THAT GOOD!
We've never had proper fish and chips in the USA, until now...so glad it's here in North Charleston!

data.title: Amazing
data.text: Best Proper Fish n chips since the UK! So worth a visit..small friendly joint..with simple straightforward fish and chips.  Definitely a gem in North Charleston.

data.title: Tasty fish and chips.
data.text: For $10 you get a huge chunk of codfish fried to perfection along with a huge portion of fries. If there are two of you, order one order of fries. My only complaint is they put the fried fish on top of the fries which imparts extra grease. Next time I would ask that they be separated.They also serve mushy peas, but I passed. Canned soft drinks are available for $1. Indoor seating is limited, but there are a few outdoor tables with umbrellas. Closed Monday and Tuesday. It's in a seedy part of North Charleston on Reynolds Ave, just outside the old Navy Shipyard gate, now blocked off. I felt safe there at lunchtime.

data.title: They Serve Fish and Chips
data.text: This is a place in the ghetto that serve fried fish, fried potatoes, and mushed peas.  I don't think they serve anything else.  It's cheap, though not as cheap as a fast food fish & chips place.  It's really good, if you like fish and chips.  It's fairly quick.  It seems to draw a crowd. Just don't post a negative review online.  Apparently one guy did that and the proprietor felt the need to call them out on a chalkboard out front.  Which is either hilarious or childish--I'm not sure which.  Maybe a little of both.

data.title: Fabulous fried cod in not so great part of town
data.text: Though the area this little restaurant is in is pretty seedy, the food is great!  Definitely not a tourist area.  The only food on the menu is fish (cod) and chips, "mushy peas", and gravy so you will need to order from these three things.  The chef is from England and he has certainly perfected fish and chips English style!

data.title: Great fish, unbelievable value
data.text:
This is a hole and the wall to rival all holes that came before it.  The Codfather really takes a risk by only offering Fish, Chips, Mushy peas, and gravy.  But when you do something perfect you don't need anything else.  

The wife and I went for early dinner to beat any crowd.  Obviously we both ordered a basket of Fish and Chips.  I added a side of mushy peas.  The portion is huge.  The next time, we might order one full basket with an extra side of chips.  

The fish came out steaming hot with a perfect thin layer of crispy heaven.  The fish was moist and flaky.    

The mushy peas, heavily seasoned with pepper, were good and unlike anything I had before.

It is hard to believe you can eat this good, this cheaply in the Charleston area
